item.title: Report E-2023110323
item.description:
Report E-2023110323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a faulty pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was containerized into an 85-gallon over-pack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110247
item.description:
Report E-2023110247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 15-gallon drum containing UN3266 was punctured by a shippers pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, and absorbents to remediate the site. All cleanup waste and the damaged container were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PD-7 IRREGG CART, WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTICE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THEN CLEANED AND REMOVED SPILL SAFELY.

item.title: Report X-2023110098
item.description:
Report X-2023110098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was being rts and was repacked into a box instead of a drum. One of the glass bottles broke into pieces causing leakage. Another Bottle had a loose cap, also allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023101471
item.description:
Report X-2023101471

  • City: SHARONVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHILE DURING THE TWILIGHT SORT, RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE AT PD3. WHILE WEARING PPE, RESPONDER TESTED LIQUID FOR ITS PH. AFTER TESTING, BROUGHT PACKAGE BACK TO PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER AND STARED PROCESSING.

Report X-2023101470

item.title: Report X-2023101443
item.description:
Report X-2023101443

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE SAW LEAKING PACKAGE ON BELT, RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PROPER PPE ON AND GOT THE SPILL CART AND FOLLOWED THE DESCISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CLEANED AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP AREA AND FOLLOWED RESPONSE SHEET TO DMP THE PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023110516
item.description:
Report X-2023110516

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unloader noticed that the package was wet and alerted QA. Found that the package was tipped at some point allowing the loose cap to start leaking. In house clean up. DescribePack: Cap on plastic bottle was loose enough to leak when tipped on its side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: In house clean up. Fiberboard absorbed much of the liquid. Placed in salvage drum awaiting disposition from pgh

item.title: Report X-2023110134
item.description:
Report X-2023110134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler was loading his tugger cart with the package in his hands. The package was a drum inside of a box. When he lowered the package to the ground the bottom of the box broke open and the drum hit the floor causing the contents to spill. DescribePack: The bottom of the drum broke open, causing a 7â€“8-inch crack along the bottom of the container. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed into a lined hazardous materials drum and the area was cleared of all package handlers.

DescribePack: One of the bottles has a crack along one of the seam allowing leakage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and neutralizing powder were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote.

  • Description: 1. X-2023101392 SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, the caps were found loose allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking. 2. X-2023101396 SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, the caps were found loose allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023101356
item.description:
Report X-2023101356

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN, SOILING OTHER PRODUCTS IN PACKAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023101355
item.description:
Report X-2023101355

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was tipped over at some point allowing the loose cap to start leaking out. Loader noticed the leaking package and alerted QA. In house clean up. DescribePack: Cap inside was placed on crooked and was not sealed. Once package was tipped, it allowed the loose cap to start leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fiberboard absorbed the liquid. Wrapped in Hazmat bag and placed in salvage drum. Awaiting disposition from PGH.

DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION HAZ DRUM HAD DENT ON TOP CAUSING SEAL TO FAIL ALLOWING SPILLAGE DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAN WAS PLACED UPRIGHT TO MITIGATE SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023101349
item.description:
Report X-2023101349

  • City: LEBANON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package handlers was opening trailer door to start to unload and noticed HAZ-MAT was leaking. They called for the manager she took pictures of said HAZ-MAT and she called for QA to come and look at said package. Once determined it was damaged QA cleaned up spill and processed the damage package. DescribePack: The lid came loose and caused the detergent to leaked out. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: The detergent was cleaned up.

  • Description: Metal can UN1993 per SDS packed in fibreboard outer packaging leaked inside ULD during offload. spill cleaned locally/secured in salvage drum. no dg markings present on outer packaging.
